Ditanya Soal Radikalisme, Ini Jawaban Calon Rektor ITB
02 Nov 2019, 08:43 by Catur Ratna Wulandari
BANDUNG, (PR).- Setelah Senat Akademik memutuskan tiga Calon Rektor ITB, ketiga kandidat mengikuti ekspos publik yang bertajuk Ngariung Bareng Calon Rektor ITB, Sabtu, 2 November 2019, di Kampus ITB. Isu soal radikalisme menjadi salah satu pertanyaan dalam acara itu.
Ketiga calon rektor tersebut ialah Jaka Sembiring (Sekolah Teknik Elektro dan Informatika), Kadarsyah Suryadi (Fakultas Teknologi Industri, Rektor ITB 2015-2020), dan Reini D. Wirahadikusuma (Fakultas Teknik Sipil dan Lingkungan).
Meski acara ini sebenarnya adalah debat terbuka Calon Rektor ITB, acara ini digelar santai. Setelah diberi kesempatan memperkenalkan diri dan memaparkan visi misi, ketiganya diminta menjawab pertanyaan dari moderator. Pertanyaan dengan jawaban setuju atau tidak setuju. Kemudian masing-masing menjelaskan alasannya. Penonton yang berasal dari civitas akademika ITB dan masyarakat luas juga diberi kesempatan untuk menanggapi dan bertanya langsung kepada kandidat.
Salah satu pertanyaan yang harus dijawab kandidat terkait dengan isu radikalisme. Para calon rektor diminta pendapatnya, apakah isu radikalisme ini nyata di ITB.
Jaka Sembiring mengangkat papan merah bertanda jempol terbalik yang berarti tidak setuju. Menurut Jaka, sebenarnya pertanyaan ini tak bisa dinawab dengan setuju atau tidak setuju saja. Ia mengatakan, urusan ini harus dibagi menjadi hard (keras) dan soft (lunak).
Cara keras, kata Jaka, menangani urusan ini seusai aturan yang berlaku. Sementara cara lunak dilakukan dengan membangun jati diri ITB.
"ITB sebagai engine of innovation, biar punya jati diri. Orang bilang apa saja, kita bica inovasi. ITB ini lahan ya g berkualitas, siapapun akan menggunakan lahan ini untuk kepentingan apapun. Selama tidak punya jati diti yang dibawa ke mana-mana, kita akan dipermainkan," tuturnya.
Kadarsyah Suryadi juga mengangkat papan merah tanda tidak setuju. Ia mengatakan, ITB sudah mengundang banyak tamu untum berbicara di forum-forum ITB, seperti di kuliah umum. Termasuk Kepala Badan Nasional Penanggulangan Terorisme (BNPT). "Ketua BNPT mengatakan tidak ada radikalisme di ITB," ucapnya.
Ia mengatakan, baik mahasiswa, dosen, juga tenaga kependidikan, twlah diambil sumpahnya ketika masuk ITB. Demikian pula para wisudawan, mereka juga mengucap sumpah serupa yaitu bersumpah untuk bersetia kepada Pancasila dan NKRI.
"Kalaupun ada yang menyimpang itu bukan ITB, itu oknum. ITB punya dignity, punya sistem dengan perangkat yang ada. Jangan sampai salah persepsi karena fitnah," tutur Kadarsyah.
Reini D. Wirahadikusuma mengacungkan papan berwarna hijau bertanda jempol. Ia mengatakan, secara sistem tentu tidak ada radikalisme di ITB. Namun menurutnya, perlu kesiagaan mengatasi persoalan itu.
"Kita lebih baik bersiaga. Kontroversi ada atau tidak ada, harus dikaji kembali. Kalau ada harus ditangani. Kalau tidak ada harus dicegah," katanya.
Kewaspadaan itu, kata dia, perlu demi kenyamanan semua warga ITB. Ia mengatakan, isu radikalisme bisa terjadi di mana-mana, bukan hanya ITB. Perlu kewaspadaan sebagai pencegahan.
Isu ini ditanggapi oleh seorang pengajar agama juga kewarganegaraan di ITB, Asep Zaenal Ausop. Menurut pengamatannya selama ini, tudingan radikalisme di ITB tidak terbukti. "Sama saja apakah kalau ada orang yang korupsi apa kemudian ITn disebut kampus koruptor? Kan tidak. Tidak signifikan jumlahnya. Tidak ada radikalisme di ITB," katanya.
Ia mengatakan, militansi mahasiswa itu bukan sebuah sikap anti Pancasila atau anti pemerintah. Ia menitip pesan agar rektor terpilihÂ tidak melarang aksi mahasiswa. "Biarkan saja mahasiswa aksi. Jangan sampai nanti rektor melarang ya," ujarnya.***

Asked About Radicalism, This Is the Answer of ITB Rector Candidates
02 Nov 2019, 08:43 by Catur Ratna Wulandari
BANDUNG, (PR) .- After the Academic Senate decided on three ITB Rector Candidates, the three candidates took part in a public exposure titled Ngariung Together with ITB Rector Candidates, Saturday, November 2, 2019, at the ITB Campus. The issue of radicalism is one of the questions in the program.
The three rector candidates are Jaka Sembiring (School of Electrical and Information Engineering), Kadarsyah Suryadi (Faculty of Industrial Technology, Rector of ITB 2015-2020), and Reini D. Wirahadikusuma (Faculty of Civil and Environmental Engineering).
Although this event is actually an open debate about the ITB Rector Candidates, the event was held casually. After being given the opportunity to introduce themselves and explain their vision and mission, the three of them were asked to answer questions from the moderator. Questions with answers agree or disagree. Then each explain the reason. Spectators from the ITB academic community and the wider community were also given the opportunity to respond and ask questions directly to candidates.
One of the questions that must be answered by candidates is related to the issue of radicalism. The prospective chancellor was asked for his opinion, whether the issue of radicalism is real at ITB.
Jaka Sembiring raised a red board with thumbs up, which meant disagreeing. According to Jaka, actually this question cannot be answered by agreeing or disagreeing. He said, this matter must be divided into hard (hard) and soft (soft).
The hard way, said Jaka, handled this matter after the rules in force. While the soft way is done by building the identity of ITB.
"ITB as an engine of innovation, so that we have identity. People say anything, we can innovate. ITB is quality land, anyone will use this land for any purpose. As long as we don't have any identity that is taken everywhere, we will be played with, "he said.
Kadarsyah Suryadi also raised a red sign sign of disapproval. He said, ITB had invited many guests to speak at ITB forums, such as in public lectures. Including the Head of the National Counterterrorism Agency (BNPT). "The Chairman of BNPT said that there was no radicalism in ITB," he said.
He said, both students, lecturers, and also education staff, the oath was taken when entering ITB. Likewise the graduates, they also took the same oath which was an oath to be loyal to Pancasila and the Republic of Indonesia.
"Even if there are those who deviate, it is not ITB, it is unscrupulous. ITB has dignity, has a system with existing devices. Do not get the wrong perception because it is slander," said Kadarsyah.
Reini D. Wirahadikusuma held up a green sign with a thumb. He said, in terms of system there would be no radicalism in ITB. But according to him, it is necessary to be prepared to overcome this problem.
"We are better on guard. Controversy is present or absent, it must be reviewed. If there is it must be dealt with. If there is nothing it must be prevented," he said.
That vigilance, he said, was necessary for the convenience of all ITB residents. He said, the issue of radicalism could occur everywhere, not just ITB. Need vigilance as prevention.
This issue was addressed by a religious teacher and citizenship at ITB, Asep Zaenal Ausop. According to his observations so far, the accusation of radicalism at ITB has not been proven. "It's the same whether there are people who are corrupt or what is ITn called a corrupt campus? It's not. There is no significant amount. There is no radicalism in ITB," he said.
He said the student militancy was not an anti-Pancasila or anti-government attitude. He sent a message that the elected rector did not prohibit student action. "Leave the action students alone. Don't let the chancellor ban you," he said. ***
